Returns: @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#PendingResult_E@ to access the data when available.
signOut(com.google.android.gms.common.ap.Description: Asynchronously signs the current user out. This call doesn't disconnect the Google API Client. As no user is signed in after this call is completed, subsequent calls to this client will very likely fail. You should either call disconnect() or finish your Activity after this call. Required API: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#API_E@ Required Scopes: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#SCOPE_GAMES_E@

Returns: An @B_android#content#Intent_E@ that can be started to view the GoogleApiClient Settings UI.
getSettingsIntent(com.google.android.gms.Description: Gets an intent to show the Settings screen that allows the user to configure Games-related features for the current game. Note that this must be invoked with @B_android#app#Activity#startActivityForResult_E@, so that the identity of the calling package can be established. A @B_com#google#android#gms#games#GamesActivityResultCodes#RESULT_RECONNECT_REQUIRED_E@ may be returned as the resultCode in @B_android#app#Activity#onActivityResult_E@ if the GoogleApiClient ends up in an inconsistent state. Most applications will not need to call this directly, since the Settings UI is already reachable from most other Games UI screens (achievements, leaderboards, etc.) via a menu item. Required API: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#API_E@ Required Scopes: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#SCOPE_GAMES_E@

Returns: Account name for the currently selected account. May be null if an error occurred while communicating with the games service.
Throws: If your app doesn't have the @B_android#Manifest#permission#GET_ACCOUNTS_E@ permission.
getCurrentAccountName(com.google.android.Description: Get the name of the currently selected account. This is the account the user has chosen to use for Google Play Games. Note that the GoogleApiClient must be connected to call this API, and your app must have <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.GET_ACCOUNTS" /> declared in your manifest in order to use this method. Required API: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#API_E@ Required Scopes: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#SCOPE_GAMES_E@

Parameters: The view to use as a content view for popups. View cannot be null.
setViewForPopups(com.google.android.gms..Description: Sets the @B_android#view#View_E@ to use as a content view for popups. Required API: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#API_E@ Required Scopes: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#SCOPE_GAMES_E@
setViewForPopups(com.google.android.gms..FullName: public static void setViewForPopups (GoogleApiClient apiClient, View gamesContentView)

Returns: The application ID linked to this client instance.
getAppId(com.google.android.gms.common.a.Description: Get the application ID linked to this client instance. Required API: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#API_E@ Required Scopes: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#SCOPE_GAMES_E@

Parameters: The gravity which controls the placement of games service popups.
setGravityForPopups(com.google.android.g.Description: Specifies the part of the screen at which games service popups (for example, "welcome back" or "achievement unlocked" popups) will be displayed using gravity. Default value is @B_android#view#Gravity#TOP_E@|@B_android#view#Gravity#CENTER_HORIZONTAL_E@. Required API: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#API_E@ Required Scopes: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#SCOPE_GAMES_E@
setGravityForPopups(com.google.android.g.FullName: public static void setGravityForPopups (GoogleApiClient apiClient, int gravity)

ClassDesc: Main entry point for the Games APIs. This class provides APIs and interfaces to access the Google Play game services functionality. To use the service, construct a @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient_E@ and pass @B_com#google#android#gms#games#Games#API_E@ to @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#Builder#addApi_E@. Once you have your @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient_E@, call @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#connect_E@ and wait for the @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient#ConnectionCallbacks#onConnected_E@ method to be called. The Bundle provided to onConnected may be null. If not null, it can contain the following keys: @B_com#google#android#gms#games#multiplayer#Multiplayer#EXTRA_INVITATION_E@ if the user wanted to accept an invitation to a multiplayer game. The value contained here is an @B_com#google#android#gms#games#multiplayer#Invitation_E@ which can be accessed with @B_android#os#Bundle#getParcelable_E@. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#multiplayer#Multiplayer#EXTRA_TURN_BASED_MATCH_E@ if the user wanted to take action in a turn-based match. The value contained here is a @B_com#google#android#gms#games#multiplayer#turnbased#TurnBasedMatch_E@ which can be accessed with @B_android#os#Bundle#getParcelable_E@. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#request#Requests#EXTRA_REQUESTS_E@ if the user wanted to accept one or more requests. The value contained here is a list of @B_com#google#android#gms#games#request#GameRequest_E@ objects which can be accessed with @B_android#os#Bundle#getParcelableArrayList_E@. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#snapshot#Snapshots#EXTRA_SNAPSHOT_METADATA_E@ if the user wanted to resume a saved game. The value contained here is a @B_com#google#android#gms#games#snapshot#SnapshotMetadata_E@ object which can be accessed with @B_android#os#Bundle#getParcelable_E@. @B_com#google#android#gms#games#quest#Quests#EXTRA_QUEST_E@ if the user wanted to accept a specific quest. The value contained here is a @B_com#google#android#gms#games#quest#Quest_E@ which can be accessed with @B_android#os#Bundle#getParcelable_E@. For more information, see the "Getting Started" guide available at
